articles.author: Maya Gebeily, James Mackenzie, John Irish
articles.description: The Paris conference aims to mobilise both humanitarian aid and support for the Lebanese military.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills Lebanese troops as France rallies support for army

articles.author: Mark John, Libby George
articles.description: As U.S. election jitters hung over this week's meeting of global finance chiefs in Washington, a smiling Vladimir Putin was in the Russian city of Kazan welcoming leaders of countries which together make up nearly half the world's population.
articles.title: BRICS gathers pace as shared grievances with West fuel alliance

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military said it had hit a Hamas command and control centre.
articles.title: At least 17 Palestinians killed in Israeli strike on school in central Gaza, hospital says

articles.author: Cheney Orr
articles.description: The journey of Rossanna and Widman began in the Guatemalan village of San Juan La Laguna, on the turquoise Lake Atitlan, where they met when he bought the tortillas she was selling for lunch.
articles.title: In Guatemala, families mourn the migrants who never reached the USA

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: Current climate policies will result in global warming of more than 3 degrees Celsius (5.4 degrees Fahrenheit) by the end of the century, according to a United Nations report on Thursday, more than twice the rise agreed to nearly a decade ago.
articles.title: Climate set to warm by 3.1 C without greater action, UN report warns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of Israel's Mossad intelligence agency will travel to Doha on Sunday to try to restart talks for a deal to release Israeli hostages being held in the Gaza Strip, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Thursday.
articles.title: Head of Israel's Mossad to travel to Doha on Sunday, Netanyahu's office says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Slovenian lawmakers on Thursday voted to cancel a referendum on building a new nuclear plant after environmental groups and experts filed complaints questioning its legality at the constitutional court.
articles.title: Slovenia cancels referendum on new nuclear plant

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A car bomb on Thursday in front of a local government's public security office in central Mexico injured three police officers, the secretariat said, in an uncommon type of attack in one of the country's most violent states.
articles.title: Car bomb attack injures three police officers in central Mexico

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former British nurse and convicted child serial killer Lucy Letby on Thursday asked a London court to let her appeal against her conviction for trying to murder a newborn baby, amid questions over the fairness of her trials.
articles.title: British nurse Lucy Letby appeals single attempted murder conviction

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol and Polish President Andrzej Duda on Thursday condemned North Korea's dispatch of troops to Russia for its war against Ukraine as a global security threat, Yoon's office said.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon, Poland's Duda condemn N.Korea troop dispatch to Russia
